SEARCH
Module com.example.dicegame
Package model.records.dice

Class RiskDice

java.lang.Object
model.records.dice.Dice
model.records.dice.RiskDice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RoyalDice
public class RiskDice extends Dice
Represents a special type of dice that has an associated risk number. The risk number determines a specific value that, when rolled, triggers a "risk" event.

This class extends the Dice class and adds a mechanism to track a "risk number", which is compared to the current side of the dice during a roll.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • returnImageName

      public String returnImageName()
      Returns the image file name for the current side of the RiskDice.

      The image name corresponds to the rolled side of the dice and is used for display purposes in the user interface.

      Specified by:
      returnImageName in class Dice
      Returns:
      the image file path for the current side of the dice (e.g., "/img/royal_dice/rd1.png")

    • riskNumberDropped

      public boolean riskNumberDropped()
      Checks if the current side of the dice matches the risk number.

      If the current side of the dice equals the risk number, this method returns true, indicating a "risk" event. Otherwise, it returns false.

      Returns:
      true if the current side matches the risk number, false otherwise

    • getRiskNumber

      public int getRiskNumber()
      Gets the current risk number for this RiskDice.
      Returns:
      the risk number associated with the dice

    • setRiskNumber

      public void setRiskNumber(int riskNumber)
      Sets the risk number for this RiskDice.
      Parameters:
      riskNumber - the new risk number to be set
